New Records: Pakistan secured a crucial seven-wicket win over Canada to stay alive in the T20 World Cup, with Mohammad Rizwan scoring an unbeaten 53 and Babar Azam contributing 33.
Mohammad Rizwan achieved his 29th T20 international half-century.
Aaron Johnson hit his sixth international fifty for Canada.
Key Match Events: A match-winning second-wicket partnership of 63 between Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam.
Canada's opening batsman Aaron Johnson hit four boundaries and four sixes in his 52.
Pakistan's bowlers took regular wickets, including Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf's contributions.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan needed a win to avoid elimination after two consecutive losses.
Canada's batting struggled despite Aaron Johnson's initial promise.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan's relief at avoiding elimination and their renewed tournament hopes.
Canada's batting collapse after a promising start.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in East Meadow, New York.
